definition[0]: the process of changing the structure and working arrangements of a company or organization
example[0]: the latest in a long string of corporate reorganizations
example[1]: The three new posts were created in the reorganization of the companyâ€™s business groups.
definition[1]: the act of officially organizing a company and its finances in a new way because it has become bankrupt
example[2]: The company has until 3 March to file areorganization plan.
example[3]: They may seek protection from creditors in a Chapter 11 reorganization (=a reorganization under US bankruptcy law).
